sarah-chen.name: Sarah Chen
sarah-chen.bio: Cafe owner and 12-year Queenstown local. I came for a season and never left. When I'm not pulling espresso shots at my cafe on the waterfront, you'll find me trail running or hunting for the best sunrise spots around the basin.

matt-wilson.name: Matt Wilson
matt-wilson.bio: Ski instructor at Coronet Peak in winter, mountain bike guide in summer. Been living the Queenstown dream for 8 years. I know every hidden trail and the best post-adventure feed spots.

emma-james.name: Emma & James
emma-james.bio: We fly over from Melbourne a couple of times a year — Queenstown is our happy place. Three kids under 10, so we've become experts at finding family-friendly adventures that keep everyone happy.

tane-hikuroa.name: Tane Hikuroa
tane-hikuroa.bio: Born and raised in the Wakatipu Basin. I run cultural tours that share the Maori history of this incredible region. Ask me about the stories behind the place names.

alex-brooks.name: Alex Brooks
alex-brooks.bio: Solo traveller and outdoor photographer. I spent 3 weeks in the Queenstown region and it completely changed how I think about adventure travel. Can't wait to come back.

jess-taylor.name: Jess Taylor
jess-taylor.bio: Travel content creator and Queenstown ambassador. I've been documenting life in the Southern Lakes for 5 years. My mission: showing people the Queenstown that exists beyond the bungy cords.

mike-fraser.name: Mike Fraser
mike-fraser.bio: Restaurant owner and wine enthusiast. After 15 years in the Queenstown hospitality scene, I've eaten at every restaurant, tasted every Central Otago pinot, and I'm still discovering new favourites.

nina-patel.name: Nina Patel
nina-patel.bio: Adventure filmmaker and photographer based between Wanaka and Queenstown. I specialise in capturing the shoulder seasons — autumn colours and spring wildflowers are my obsession.
